block.p: Caitlyn Marie Dlouhy and Timothy Alexius Meis are to be married today by Msgr. Thomas Harrington at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in South Dartmouth, Mass.

The bride, 37, is a senior editor in New York at Atheneum Books for Young Readers, an imprint of Simon & Schuster. She graduated cum laude from the University of New Hampshire and received a master's degree in fiction from the University of Pittsburgh. She is the daughter of Sheila Foster Dlouhy and Gerald E. Dlouhy of South Dartmouth.
Caitlyn Marie Dlouhy and Timothy Alexius Meis are to be married today by Msgr. Thomas Harrington at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in South Dartmouth, Mass.

The bride, 37, is a senior editor in New York at Atheneum Books for Young Readers, an imprint of Simon & Schuster. She graduated cum laude from the University of New Hampshire and received a master's degree in fiction from the University of Pittsburgh. She is the daughter of Sheila Foster Dlouhy and Gerald E. Dlouhy of South Dartmouth.

The bridegroom, 34, is the editor in chief of Agnes .com, a company based in Bedminster, N.J.; it is developing a Web site for women that will offer housewares, handbags and accessories, along with recipes and health information. He graduated from Providence College. His parents, Carol and Donald A. Meis, live in Brookside, N.J.
